class.name: monitor
class.purpose: A wrapper which provides insures locked access to an object.

description.para: monitor allows for the easy creation of simple monitor objects. A monitor provides automatically locked access to its contained object's members through its scoped lock classes, which can be used like pointers. It stores its contained object by value, as an alternative to the pointer-like interface of monitor_ptr. Copies of a monitor object are deep copies, which do not share the same mutex/condition.

Although any copy-constructible object may be contained in a monitor, special support is provided for classes derived from monitor_base. This allows classes derived from monitor_base to wait on conditions inside member function calls, releasing the monitor's mutex until the condition is satisfied.

The Mutex template type must be a model of the Mutex concept as described in the Boost Thread library. If Mutex is additionally a model of the TryMutex or TimedMutex concept then the nested class monitor::scoped_try_lock is available for "try locking". If Mutex is a model of the TimedMutex concept then the nested class monitor::scoped_timed_lock is also available for "timed locking". Libpoet determines if the Mutex template type parameter supports try or timed locking by testing the value of mutex_properties<Mutex>::model.

listitem.para: monitor_ptr: a pointer-like alternative to the monitor class.

description.para: monitor::scoped_lock models the ScopedLock concept described by the Boost Thread libarary, with its associated mutex type being monitor. In addition, scoped_lock can be used like a pointer via its member access and dereference operators, which provide safe access to an object owned by a monitor.
Creates a scoped lock which can be used to safely access the object owned by a monitor, and calls lock.
Creates a scoped lock which can be used to safely access the object contained in a monitor. If do_lock is true, calls lock().

Creates a scoped lock which can be used to safely access the object contained in a monitor. If do_lock is true, calls lock().
Copies the value of type T into the monitor. The monitor's mutex is locked before the copy occurs.

If the rhs parameter is a monitor type, then its mutex is also locked before its contained value is copied out of it. Care is taken not to lock both monitor objects simultaneously to avoid violating or establishing a locking order between the two monitors (which might result in deadlock). Copies of a monitor object are deep copies, which do not share the same mutex or condition.
Swaps the values of *this and other. This function is provided to implement a specialization of std::swap for this class, which may enhance efficiency with generic algorithms.

Care is taken not to lock both monitor objects simultaneously to avoid violating or establishing a locking order between the two monitors (which might result in deadlock). The swap operation performs the following steps:

listitem.para: Copy constructs a temporary value of type T from the value in other, while other is locked.
Swaps the temporary value with the value of *this, while *this is locked.
Swaps the temporary value with the value of other, while other is locked.

description.para: Therefore, it is possible another thread could lock other and perform some operation on it between the point where its value is copied out, and the point where the value from *this is swapped back into other.
Creates a monitor with a default-constructed value.
Creates a monitor which contains a copy of the specified value.
Creates a monitor whose contained value is a copy of the value contained in the other parameter. other is locked before its value is copied out.
